channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Clarity needed on crypto lending regulations - UK Law Commission
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: The Law Commission’s recommendations highlights the need to clarify whether cryptocurrency lending falls under existing financial collateral regulations.

item.title: Music with AI elements can win a Grammy, Recording Academy CEO says in report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The CEO of the Recording Academy, known for its yearly Grammy awards, reportedly clarified that music with AI-created elements is eligible for award nominations.

item.title: South Africa to mandate crypto exchange licenses by year-end: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: South Africa reportedly becomes the first country on the continent to require digital asset exchanges to be licensed.

item.title: Bitcoin analysis agrees BTC price may stall at $35K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price will have trouble breaking above $35,000, various analysts warn, as major resistance appears on Binance.

item.title: Binance Australia offices reportedly searched by local regulator
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Binance said it is cooperating with Australian regulators to meet local regulatory requirements amid reports of office searches.

item.title: Crypto Twitter will see less exposure on Google due to rate limit slash
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Another impact of Elon Musk’s Twitter limits is lower search visibility on Google, according to SEO experts.

item.title: Darknet bad actors work together to steal your crypto, here’s how — Binance CSO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: Crypto hackers have turned their attention toward the crypto user, and “security hygiene” is more important than ever, according to Binance’s Jimmy Su.

item.title: Meta’s Twitter rival Threads to launch July 6, but will the crypto community budge?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Meta’s microblogging platform is set for launch, with Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey pointing out the app’s centralization and data harvesting.

item.title: Mark Cuban, John Reed Stark clash over the cause of FTX’s collapse
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Mark Cuban thinks the SEC could have saved U.S. customers from FTX had it adopted Japan’s approach to crypto regulation, but John Reed Stark disagrees.

item.title: Account abstraction will drive a billion users from Asia to Web3: ConsenSys exec
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: In addition to “smart accounts,” Ethereum adoption will be boosted by Web3 gaming along with zkEVM scaling and security, says Laura Shi.

item.title: OpenAI pauses ChatGPT’s Bing feature, as users were jumping paywalls
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: OpenAI found a bug in its Browse plugin that inadvertently allowed users to read paywalled articles in some cases.

item.title: Advocates call for Hong Kong govt stablecoin to compete with Tether and USD Coin
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: “Issuing a stablecoin pegged to the Hong Kong dollar not only helps to solidify Hong Kong’s leadership in the blockchain sector but also propels the progress of the digital Hong Kong dollar," said the report.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: UK government moves forward on bill aimed at empowering authorities to seize crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Following a third reading in the House of Lords, the Economic Crime and Corporate Transparency Bill will return to lawmakers to consider changes before being signed into law.

item.title: Lido, Rocket Pool team members argue over decentralization
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: A Lido team member claimed Rocket Pool is not really governed by its DAO, but Rocket Pool community members pushed back, claiming the protocol is becoming more decentralized.

item.title: Researchers demonstrate ‘unconditionally secure’ quantum digital payments
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The research represents a possible breakthrough in quantum communications and, potentially, the onset of the era of quantum fintech.

item.title: Bitcoin ETFs: Even worse for crypto than central exchanges
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Josef Tetek
item.description: Want some worthless "paper" Bitcoin? With the rise of Bitcoin ETFs, you might soon have the chance to invest in something as worthless as the U.S. dollar.

item.title: UK financial watchdog reminds crypto firms of October deadline for marketing compliance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Companies operating in the U.K. will have only “four routes to lawfully communicate cryptoasset promotions” in order to be in compliance with the FCA’s regime.

item.title: Bitcoin futures premium hits 18-month high — Time to flip bullish?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: The Bitcoin futures premium surge is having traders ask whether this is excitement or a return to the average after a multimonth bear market.

item.title: 5 talent marketplaces to hire developers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Discover the top talent marketplaces for hiring skilled developers for your projects.

item.title: Google updates its privacy policy to allow data scraping for AI training
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The latest updates to Google’s privacy policy reveal that Google may use any public information available to train its various AI products and services.

item.title: Zero Barriers podcast series: Crypto adoption fueled by ZK-rollups
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: The podcast series is produced in collaboration with StarkWare and explores the future of ZK-rollups as an Ethereum layer-2 solution.

item.title: Bitcoin ETF race begins: Has institutional trust returned to crypto?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Seven institutional firms have filed for a spot Bitcoin ETF in the U.S., including the world’s largest asset manager BlackRock, driving optimism and higher Bitcoin prices.

item.title: Venture capital’s ICO gambits left Bitcoin ecosystem underfunded — Adam Back
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Venture capitalists have favored ICOs in recent years, but Bitcoin-related startups are seeing renewed interest from investors.

item.title: Bitcoin analyst flags $32.5K launchpad zone for BTC price
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin is enjoying “good consolidation,” a popular analyst says, as bets on further BTC price upside coming next multiply.

item.title: China to tighten control on exports of AI chip-making materials
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The Chinese government has announced that it plans to control the export of gallium and germanium products heavily used to produce semiconductors.

item.title: Creditors for bankrupt Voyager Digital billed $5.1M in legal fees
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: Voyager is not the only crypto firm incurring hefty legal fees; FTX, for example, has been billed over $120 million in fees.

item.title: US crypto regulatory uncertainty could be Hong Kong’s gain — Yat Siu
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Animoca Brands founder Yat Siu believes Hong Kong’s efforts to foster the Web3 ecosystem are in stark contrast to regulatory uncertainty hampering development in the United States.

item.title: Chinese city of Jinan accepts CBDC payments for bus rides
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The Chinese city of Jinan is pushing for CBDC adoption by implementing digital yuan payments across its entire bus network.

item.title: Crypto firms won’t leave US despite apparent hostility: Merkle Science CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Mitchelhill
item.description: Merkle Science CEO Mriganka Pattnaik has offered a “contrarian” take, explaining that crypto firms won’t vanish from the United States anytime soon.
